advantages.name: Talen Apeskin
advantages.desc: Human or ape skin worn over one's skin that makes the user immune to silver in glabro or hispo form. Makes regeneration impossible for a full day after wearing.

advantages.name: Apeskin
advantages.desc: Human or ape skin worn over one's skin that makes the user immune to silver in glabro or hispo form. Makes regeneration impossible for a full day after wearing.

advantages.name: Death's Head Brooch (Talen)
advantages.desc: A bejeweled trinket that makes the wearer appear as one of the undead, undetectable by Leeches. The wearer appears pallid, cool to the touch, heartless, and breathless, with blood that tastes and smells like the undead. It does not grant powers or weaknesses, only the appearance.

advantages.name: Death's Head Brooch (Talisman)
advantages.desc: A bejeweled trinket that makes the wearer appear as one of the undead, undetectable by Leeches. The wearer appears pallid, cool to the touch, heartless, and breathless, with blood that tastes and smells like the undead. It does not grant powers or weaknesses, only the appearance.

advantages.name: Electric Camouflage (Talen)
advantages.desc: An ointment made of silver dust, riverbed clay, and oils applied to the face that blurs the wearer's visage from electronic records until sunrise. If the wearer shifts into Crinos under the effect, they take Aggravated damage from the silver.

advantages.name: Gaia's Tear
advantages.desc: An incredibly rare umbral fossil that when meditated upon can remove a dot of harano or hauglosk. Discuss with your ST if it appropriate to start with this item. It has no set cost.

advantages.name: Grand Klaive (Talisman)
advantages.desc: A massive silver sword bound with two spirits—a war spirit and another that grants additional effects like fire, frost, electricity, or Willpower damage. Requires a Rage Check when wielded; on failure, the wielder loses a point of Rage and drops the blade. Deals +3 silver-based Aggravated Health damage and can be used in homid or glabro form.

advantages.name: Hammer of King Brennus
advantages.desc: 4-dot Talisman. +4 damage; Black Spiral Dancers take Aggravated damage and suffer -2 dice to attack pools against it. Wielder needs Strength 4+ or suffers -2 dice to attack. If defeated by a Dancer or the hammer is lost, the wielder must roll a Difficulty 2 Harano test.

advantages.name: Harmony Flute
advantages.desc: An ornate flute bearing the image of Luna and Helios dancing, can pull a Garou back from their frenzied rage.

advantages.name: Herald's Horn
advantages.desc: 3-dot Talisman. When blown, all pack members instantly know the user's location and the safest, quickest route to reach them. Grants +2 dice to any rolls needed to arrive safely or on time.

advantages.name: Talen Klaive
advantages.desc: The signature weapon of Garou society, +2 silver-based agg damage. Cannot be used in Crinos form.

advantages.name: Klaive
advantages.desc: The signature weapon of Garou society, +2 silver-based agg damage. Cannot be used in Crinos form.

advantages.name: Partridge Wing
advantages.desc: Prevents a single mortal from suffering from the effects of delerium.

advantages.name: Single Sized Shadowshard
advantages.desc: A physical piece of the Umbra often appearing as a piece of glass. Upon breaking it allows the user to instantly enter the umbra when the gauntlet is below 3 dif. Only works on Garou.

advantages.name: Pack Sized Shadowshard
advantages.desc: A physical piece of the Umbra often appearing as a piece of glass. Upon breaking it allows the user and their pack to instantly enter the umbra when the gauntlet is below 3 dif. Only works on Garou.

advantages.name: Shadow Mirror (Talisman)
advantages.desc: A glass mirror that reveals spirits, invisible creatures, and the true nature of beings for one scene when the user spends one Willpower. If the bound spirit acts independently, its attempts appear in the mirror. Grants a two-dice bonus when used with the Augur Gift.

advantages.name: Spider Box (Talisman)
advantages.desc: A pair of Weaver-spirits bound to communication devices that create an open channel between realities, allowing packmates to communicate across the Gauntlet. The boxes only work when separated by the Gauntlet and always come in pairs.

advantages.name: Talen Spirit Catcher
advantages.desc: A generalized spirit catcher than is capable of containing a single spirit. Cannot specify which spirit if there are multiple.

advantages.name: Spirit Catcher
advantages.desc: A specialized spirit catcher that can better attract a single-type of spirit during a scene.

advantages.name: Spirit Prison (Gaffling)
advantages.desc: A wish-granting item (often shaped like an oil lamp, ring, or jug) that can summon a bound spirit up to three times to perform tasks within its means. The owner spends one Willpower to summon the spirit, which carries out the task and returns until all wishes are used. The spirit may misinterpret commands intentionally.

advantages.name: Spirit Prison (Jaggling)
advantages.desc: A wish-granting item (often shaped like an oil lamp, ring, or jug) that can summon a bound spirit up to three times to perform tasks within its means. The owner spends one Willpower to summon the spirit, which carries out the task and returns until all wishes are used. The spirit may misinterpret commands intentionally.

advantages.name: Umbral Dust
advantages.desc: A chalky paste that, when applied to palms, eyelids, and feet, grants a one-die bonus to tests for the Rite of Shadow Passage. Highly valued by urban packs for facilitating entry into the Umbra.

advantages.name: Talen Wind Whistle
advantages.desc: When blown, the spirits cause a large gust of wind covering the tracks of the pack with snow, debris or dust making it far harder to track them.

advantages.name: Wind Whistle
advantages.desc: When blown, the spirits cause a large gust of wind covering the tracks of the pack with snow, debris or dust making it far harder to track them.

advantages.name: Wolf Musk
advantages.desc: A colorless liquid sprayed on two targets to swap their scents until one washes, allowing Garou to lay false trails or misdirect hunters.

advantages.name: Iron Hatchet
advantages.desc: A brutal weapon used by Black Spiral Dancers. Deals +2 damage, and on a successful hit, the wielder may sacrifice up to 3 Health (Superficial or Aggravated) to deal that much extra damage of the same type.

advantages.name: Bone Scourge
advantages.desc: A black leather whip studded with bone spikes. Deals +3 damage, and each successful hit also inflicts 1 Willpower damage—2 if the target is defending family or loved ones.

advantages.name: Killer's Crown
advantages.desc: A crude iron crown fused into the skull. Wearer always has at least 1 Rage and counts Rage as 2 higher (max 5) for Rage dice. Removing it causes 3 Aggravated damage and requires a Strength + Medicine test (Diff 3 if helped, 4 solo).

advantages.name: Warm Stone
advantages.desc: A fist-sized radioactive rock that prevents all forms of healing—natural, supernatural, or Gift-based—within the same room. Prolonged exposure is lethal.
